p: The people most affected by SARS-CoV-2 infection are adults aged >60Â years with one or more concomitant medical conditions such as cardiovascular, hepatic, renal and/or bone marrow co-morbidities. Neutropenia, hepatitis, increased hepatic enzymes, QT prolongation, and bone marrow dysfunction are possible COVID-19 manifestations and potential adverse events of chloroquine, hydroxychloroquine, Tocilizumab, Sarilumab, and anti-IL-1 agents [ 2]. Steroids, and anti-IL-6 and anti-IL-1 agents may lead to profound immunosuppression and increase the risk of infections, and anti-IL-6 agents have also been associated with bacterial pneumonia and gastrointestinal perforation [ [10], [11], [12], [13], [14], [15], [16]].
